text: I am here to help you understand why dog meat is as ethical as beef, pork, chicken, or fish

next.text: Pigs, cows, chickens, lambs, fish, and even dogs
They are all meat!  As an omnivore, this shouldn't be an issue
Let's figure out what makes dogs so special
Some dogs are pets. Some are bred for vivisection. Other are born straight.
Our dogs are reared for their meat and certified not-a-pet. They are bred on farms and tagged at birth. When caught in the wild, they are checked for any micro-chip.
Some pigs are pets, and not bacon
Some chickens are pets, and not nuggets
Some cows are pets, and not steak
Give any animal time, care, compassion, and they likely will become your best friend. This trait isn't unique to dogs.
Is that enough of an excuse to stop you from eating other animals because they are pets in the eyes of other people?

options.text: It's different, dogs are man's best friends

next.text: For you and many other people, your culture dicates that it is morally okay to breed and slaughter a cow for food, but not a dog
But in other cultures, it is immoral to slaughter a cow
Should culture dictate your morals?
Cultures evolve all the time. Every new generation decide what to keep or ditch from older generations's culture
It was once culturally accepted that the poor should be the slave of the rich
Not long ago, your skin color would dictate the same fate
It was culturally accepted that women belonged to men, and weren't as competent as they were
In some other parts of the world, it is morally okay to eat dogs
Do you believe it is immoral to eat dogs?

options.text: Hm... I am starting to think it is immoral to eat any animals
Actually... You may have a point, eating dogs could be moral

next.text: Exactly. It's either that, OR it is immoral to slaughter animals. What's important is to be consistent if your moral beliefs.
Before you rush to try dog meat, let's make sure you understand why you eat meat

options.text: I love the taste of non-dog meat!

next.text: Of course it is! And so is dog meat! Actually, some of our customers have said dog meat is even tastier than anything else they have eaten before!
Here is a thought experiment for you
Agree or disagree with the following statements I am going to show you
It is okay to walk up to a person to punch them in the head if it gives you sensory pleasure
It is okay to punch a punching bag if it gives you sensory pleasure
It is okay to walk up to a dog and punch them in the head if it gives you sensory pleasure
It is okay to walk up to a pig and punch them in the head if it gives you sensory pleasure

messages.text: Do you believe people don't deserve moral worth?
Do you believe animals are sentient?

next.text: So what makes it okay to inflict pain to a pig, but not a dog?

messages.text: Whale hello there 🐳
Most people, like yourself, assign moral worth to people and animals. Not just people and dogs.
Even animals we see as food are deserving of moral worth
On a scale from 1 to 10, how much suffering do you think farm animals experience from the day they are born, to the day they are slaughtered?
messages.hint: Where 1 means "Don't suffer" and 10 means  "Suffer greatly"

next.text: Absolutely
Therefore, if cutlure is not a an acceptable reason to not eat dogs, what is it that makes eating dogs immoral?

options.text: I am not going to stop eating animals someone else considers as pets

next.text: And so you shouldn't ask other people to not eat dogs, just because you consider them as pets
So, what is it that makes dogs so special?
Can't argue against that statement
Dogs can be smart
But they can also be dumb
Cows can also be smart
Fish can also be smart
Pigs are considered as smart, if not even smarter than dogs
The problem is that you are used to seeing dogs in environments they can thrive
Farmed animals are kept in conditions in which they cannot thrive
All animals are intelligent, you only choose to see intelligence in dogs
Will that stop you from eating other intelligent species?

options.text: I only eat lesser intelligent animals

next.text: As with humans, species have a range of intelligence
Also they belong to the same species, some individuals are less intelligent than others
Some of these individuals can be less intelligent than other animals of species considered less intelligent
Our dog farmers have artificially selected the lesser intelligent dogs of each breed of dogs
We can assure you any of the dogs we harvest are as, if not less intelligent than a cow

options.text: Eating dumb dogs is absolutely fine

next.text: Now that we have established that eating dumb animals is morally okay
And that homosapiens is one of the many species belonging to the animal kingdom
Would it be moral to farm humans with mental illnesses that render them as cognitively capable as our sub-intelligent dogs?
Thought experiment time!
Imagine that aliens invade earth and capture us all
They are way more intelligent than we are
From their point of view, we might as well be cows in term of intelligence
Would it be wrong of them to do to us what we do to animals?
Do you believe might makes right?
Why?
Right... Okay!
Looks like we have gone full circle
To summarise where we are at:
You believed it was wrong to eat dogs
Convinced you it was okay to eat dumber dogs because intelligence does not matter
But if a more intelligent species (like we are to animals) did this to us
You would not approve because intelligence matter
It sounds to me like you haven't put much thought into the morality of eating meat altogether

options.text: Still wrong! But I am not going to stop eating animals because they are as dumb, or more intelligent than your dogs

next.text: Okay, so it sounds like you are saying intelligence isn't a good enough reason to not eat dogs
So what makes it immoral to not eat dumb dogs?

options.text: I am not going to stop eating animals because they are intelligent

next.text: If not intelligence, what is it that makes dog so special?
Do you believe the animals you eat are devoid of emotions?
That's a common mistake many people make
We are so accustomed to seeing animals on farms
Literally doing nothing but to just stand there and to wait to be fed
But it's far from the truth, they can be as emotional as a dog
Glad we could agree!
Many people believe farm animals are just empty shells
Animals are sentient beings
Meaning, they are are able to perceive or feel things
They can experience a wide range of emotions such as joy, fear, love, despair, and grief
This has been officially recognised by the british government
Here is a joyful cow
Here is one experiencing fear and despair
It is no longer a debate if animals can or cannot have feelings
They do. And it isn't exclusive to dogs
Knowing all animals you eat experience emotions, the same as dogs do, will this stop you from eating meat?

options.text: Hm... I am starting to think it is immoral to eat any animals
Actually... You may have a point, eating dogs could be moral
No, the ability to feel emotions is irrelevant

next.text: Alright! So being capable of experiencing emotions is irrelevant
So what makes dogs so special that they deserve to be treated differently?

options.text: Eating dog is not part of my culture

next.text: Should culture dictate your morals?
Cultures evolve all the time. Every new generation decide what to keep or ditch from older generations's culture
It was once culturally accepted that the poor should be the slave of the rich
Not long ago, your skin color would dictate the same fate
It was culturally accepted that women belonged to men, and weren't as competent as they were
In some other parts of the world, it is morally okay to eat dogs
Do you believe it is immoral to eat dogs?

options.text: Hm... I am starting to think it is immoral to eat any animals
Actually... You may have a point, eating dogs could be moral

next.text: Exactly. It's either that, OR it is immoral to slaughter animals. What's important is to be consistent if your moral beliefs.
Before you rush to try dog meat, let's make sure you understand why you eat meat

options.text: I love the taste of non-dog meat!

next.text: Of course it is! And so is dog meat! Actually, some of our customers have said dog meat is even tastier than anything else they have eaten before!
Here is a thought experiment for you
Agree or disagree with the following statements I am going to show you
It is okay to walk up to a person to punch them in the head if it gives you sensory pleasure
It is okay to punch a punching bag if it gives you sensory pleasure
It is okay to walk up to a dog and punch them in the head if it gives you sensory pleasure
It is okay to walk up to a pig and punch them in the head if it gives you sensory pleasure

messages.text: Do you believe people don't deserve moral worth?
Do you believe animals are sentient?

next.text: So what makes it okay to inflict pain to a pig, but not a dog?

messages.text: Whale hello there 🐳
Most people, like yourself, assign moral worth to people and animals. Not just people and dogs.
Even animals we see as food are deserving of moral worth
On a scale from 1 to 10, how much suffering do you think farm animals experience from the day they are born, to the day they are slaughtered?
messages.hint: Where 1 means "Don't suffer" and 10 means  "Suffer greatly"

next.text: Absolutely
Therefore, if cutlure is not a an acceptable reason to not eat dogs, what is it that makes eating dogs immoral?

options.text: I'm not sure, it's a feeling I have

next.text: That's okay
We are told to think a certain way toward animals as we grow up
Some are pets and deserve to be cared for and protected
Others don't deserve any moral consideration, and can be slaughtered for our consumption
If you have time to spare, may I recommend you watch a video?
It explains exactly why you feel this way in great details
The first 10 minutes will cover enough if you are short on time
Take your time, I'll be waiting so we can discuss further what you've watched

messages.text: Nice! 🙌
You may be wondering why this video was about veganism
The argument in favour of eating dogs is very similar to the argument against eating any animal products
It's a question of being consistent with our morals
Either you agree all animals can be exploited for food
Or no animals should be exploited for food
Has your view on eating dogs changed?

options.text: I now view dogs as potential food source
I still think it is immoral to eat dogs, but moral to eat other animals

next.text: Would you drink dog milk?
Excellent! PuppyBox will soon offer dog milk
Our suppliers will follow the same standards as the dairy industry
Our bitches (female dogs) are forcefully impregnated so they can give birth to a litter and start producing milk
The litter is separated from the mom at birth so we can harvest the milk for human consumption.
The separation can be difficult for both the mother and her puppies, but don't worry, our bitches get used to it after their third or fourth litter
Puppies are isolated from one another so they can't get hurt during play time
It's a lonely life but they get used to it
Female puppies will be raised to become milk producing bitches

messages.text: Do you eat veal by any chance?
Male puppies are a waste product to the dog dairy farms, so they are either killed at birth, or reared for puppy veal
Puppy veal is so tender it pretty much melts in your mouth
You are supporting the processing of such products by consuming dairy
So you might as well enjoy it!

next.text: Great, you're going to love this!
Aww, that's a shame

messages.text: Male puppies are a waste product to the dog dairy farms, so they are either killed at birth, or reared for puppy veal
Puppy veal is so tender it pretty much melts in your mouth
You are supporting the processing of such products by consuming dairy
So you might as well enjoy it!

next.text: Isn't it strange how we find it absolutely normal to drink milk from a cow
But milk from any other species sounds quite repulsive
Even drinking milk from our own species after a certain age can be considered weird
Check out this video about dairy
It might change the opinion you have toward dairy

options.text: Done! I watched the first 10 minutes

next.text: Aw, okay!
We aren't going to be able to convince you that dog meat is ethical...
Same as you can't convince us it is ethical to be vegetarian
If dairy and egg is ethical to your standard
We can assure you our dogs are treated way more nicely than dairy cows or egg laying hens
Either you are against animal exploitation altogether
Or you agree animals can be exploited
But animal exploitation will always require "spent" individuals to be killed
Otherwise they would cost money to the farmer to keep them alive
Check this video out:
Until you're vegan, you can't really argue against the exploitation of dogs
If you want to give it a shot, try this free service
challenge22.com
Bye! 👋

options.text: Watched it, and you have a point

next.text: Yeah, it's pretty brutal

options.text: Watched it, but you didn't change my mind
Haven't watched it, vegetarianism is ethical

next.text: Well, that's awkward...
So are we!
Activism through satire
Make sure to follow us:
On twitter
On instagram
Every share increases the chances of a dog lover to come across our content and have their habbits and views challenged!
All that to say: nothing to worry about, this is satire and fake. No dogs are being reared for meat.
